page.title: 11LITTLE MARCLE RELIGION (2)
page.content: {St.John the Baptist Anglican Church} {Preston } This small stone church of Norman origin stands in the grounds of Preston Court, a well preserved half-timbered manor house. The most striking feature is the recently renovated l4th century porch & the Norman entrance arch. Note the relief carving of the Agnus Dei in the tympanum. The last restoration was in l859 when the south aisle was added. There is some old stained glass of the Crucifixion. The register dates from the l6th century. Services are run on a rota system with three other churches in the Gloucester Diocese, includung Dymock.
